key_facts: Perplexity launched 'Perplexity Computer' â€” a unified system integrating all current AI capabilities into one interface
Released pplx-embed: new SOTA multilingual bidirectional embedding models (based on Qwen3) optimized for noisy, web-scale retrieval tasks

pplx-embed is claimed to outperform Google's embedding APIs and serves as a production-ready open alternative to proprietary services

title: ğŸ”¬ Sakana AI's Doc-to-LoRA & Perplexity's Bidirectional Qwen3: Two Breakthroughs in Long-Context Efficiency

sources.author: omarsar0
sources.text:
NEW research from Sakana AI.

Long contexts get expensive as every token in the input contributes to quadratic attention costs, higher latency, and more memory.

This new research introduces Doc-to-Lo

sources.author: LiorOnAI
sources.text:
Most language models only read forward.

Perplexity just open-sourced 4 models that read text in both directions.

They used a technique from image generation to retrain Qwen3 so every word can see ev

key_facts: Sakana AI introduced Doc-to-LoRA â€” a hypernetwork that compresses long documents into LoRA adapters in a single forward pass, enabling near-perfect needle-in-a-haystack accuracy at >4Ã— native context length

Perplexity open-sourced bidirectional variants of Qwen3 (0.6B/4B) using full-document attention (inspired by image generation), achieving document-level understanding with MIT-licensed, commercially usable models

Both approaches eliminate iterative context reprocessing: Doc-to-LoRA avoids repeated context consumption via adapter internalization; Perplexityâ€™s models enable each token to attend to the entire document in one pass
analyst_angle: These are complementary architectural leapsâ€”Doc-to-LoRA tackles inference-time context efficiency via dynamic adapter synthesis, while Perplexityâ€™s bidirectional models re-engineer representation learning itselfâ€”signaling a shift from 'context window scaling' to 'context-aware parameterization' as the new frontier for production-grade long-context LLMs.

key_facts: Runway Robotics team introduced a General World Model to simulate robot policies in software
8 simulated robot policies achieved 0.95 correlation with real-world performance
World model simulation shows promise as a scalable, cost-effective alternative to physical hardware testing
analyst_angle: This advances the practical deployment of embodied AI by significantly lowering the barrier to iterative robot learningâ€”potentially accelerating robotics R&D cycles from months to days.
